‚ÄúHello and, again, welcome to the Aperture Science computer-aided enrichment center.‚Äù

Portal‚Äôs formula remains relatively simple and straightforward throughout. Each level turns into your temporary playground as you traverse from portal to portal at meteoric speeds like a true acrobat, soaring through puzzle after puzzle amidst white walled test chambers in a never ending cycle. Despite all of this, the game never feels mundane or monotonous. Perhaps the key lies in the pacing of the near perfectly designed levels. Once you have mastered a certain mechanic, the game will introduce you to a new one in a clever seamless methodical pace, keeping the gears ever-turning in the perpetual machine.

Every one of the intricate mechanics is utilised effectively in each puzzle, allowing for a great variation in difficulty and scale between them. Some are presented in grand and complex levels, while others exist within smaller and simpler confines. Amongst the multitude of areas, you might stop to inspect the white paneling adorning the walls, gazing into the pristine void as it peers right back. Or, perhaps, you will choose to longingly stare at the grubby ceiling, dreaming of the vibrant blue sky that lives beyond. It is a peaceful period of time, where you are left in an unparalleled solitude with your thoughts, as you reflect and contemplate on everything that gradually sinks in. 

The gameplay elements are all successfully realised and the puzzles‚Äôs potentials fully explored, in part thanks to the signature atmosphere. Behind the charming humour and friendly presentation, the atmosphere takes on an eerie and almost ominous tone. Traversing the bleak claustrophobic hallways stretching throughout the facility, leaving only a distant echo of your hasty footsteps. Confined into a deep slumber, the observation booths carefully watch from above, seemingly tracking your every move, yet only projecting a deafening silence. It is difficult to put a finger on what exactly it is, something is just not right.

With all of that said, Portal is one of the finest examples of where originality, innovation, and creativity can take us. A beautiful work of art. The journey might be short, but it is a memorable one that will stick with you for many years to come.

Portal is the most iconic and loved puzzle game ever made. The concept is creative and extremely well executed. Great challenge modes. Storyline is as good as it needs to be. Pop culture influence is at a pleasant and bearable level. Effectively without flaws.

El juego de los portales es bastante sencillo,unico y perfecto. Valve venia de una racha de juegos bastantes buenos pero este fue el punto clave del porque valve es una de las mejores empresas de videojuegos. Tiene un inicio que se entiende completamente el juego de principio a fin, la libertad es una de las cosas mas importante para los humanos y este juego podria representar nuestro mundo o quizas este exagerando. Se me olvida la historia, los personajes al progresar en este juego y eso es exquisitamente bueno, te deja hacer, poder imaginar de las posibilidades de pasarte el nivel (Que se reduce a 2) Te olvidas de todo y te diviertes como un ni√±o, la diversion es importante para este juego que dura 3 horas, puede que sea corto pero puede ser preciado tiempo que no gastaste. Un juego corto que a veces puede costar un ri√±on y dos teclados rotos pero no te quejas porque sabes que este juego te puede a llegar a sacar bastantes emociones. Finalmente el final es algo reflexivo te das cuenta que este juego tiene una historia al terminarlo y menos mal que existe un 2 porque me cortaria dos cocos. En fin gran trabajo, excelente estrategia pero no promocionaron bien, y eso como fan me decepciona. Quiero que este juego "simple" sea reconocido no como un juego mas sino un juego importante y divertido.

Heilige schei√üe ist das gut
